info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:27PM CDT until June 16 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR CLEVELAND...WESTERN POTTAWATOMIE AND WEST CENTRAL MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 927 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over southeastern Norman, or near Lake Thunderbird, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Shawnee, Tecumseh, Noble, Slaughterville, Pink, Goldsby, Tribbey, Wanette, Etowah, Brooksville, Macomb, Stella, Stanley Draper Lake, Lake Thunderbird, Bethel Acres, Little Axe, and Trousdale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
